channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8220] can we record the count opened HTable for HTablePool
item.description: In HTablePool, we have a method getCurrentPoolSize(...) to get how many opened HTable has been pooled. However, we don't know ConcurrentOpenedHTable which means the count of HTable get from HTablePool.getTable(...) and don't return to HTablePool by PooledTable.close(). The ConcurrentOpenedHTable may be meaningful because it indicates how many HTables should be opened for the application which may help us set the appropriate MaxSize of HTablePool. Therefore, we can and a ConcurrentOpenedHTable as a counter in HTablePool.
item.summary: can we record the count opened HTable for HTablePool

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: I don't se any issue with adding that. Are you going to provide a patch?
Moving description from the "environment" field.
patch for HBASE-8220.0.94.3
ok, I make a path for this issue, could you please help to review?

Sound good to me.

Few comments.

  • Remove the extra space at the end of this.concurrentUsingTableCounts = new ConcurrentHashMap<String, AtomicInteger>();
  • Remove the extra space at the end of + if ((previousCount = concurrentUsingTableCounts.putIfAbsent(tableName, initCount)) == null) {
  • In returnTable, I'm not sure we should reduce the counter after releaseHTableInterface and not before. The table you are removing will already be removed from the "tables" field even if releaseHTableInterface fails. I think we should keep the 2 in sync and therefore make sure decrementAndGet is called before releaseHTableInterface. Might need to have a 2nd opinion on that.
  • concurrentUsingTableCounts field (and subsequent methods) might be renamed concurrentUsedTableCounts or something similar (concurrentTableCount, etc.)
  • Make sure the patch is build over the 0.94 branch and not a specific 0.94.x tag.

Have you run the test suite locally? Does it pass?

Thanks for your review. Comments#3 looks a little complex. As you describe, if we put decrementAndGet after releaseHTableInterface, the HTable has been removed from HTable.tables while concurrentUsingTableCounts won't decrease if releaseHTableInterface throws an exception. On the other hand, if we put decrementAndGet before releaseHTableInterface, we may depend on what the users do when they getting an IOException from PoolTable.close(...). For example, if the users retries some times after this exception, concurrentUsingTableCounts will decrease many times. From this aspect, it may be a little better to put decrementAndGet after releaseHTableInterface. If HTable close fail, users should handle the exception, decide to retry until success(concurrentUsingTableCounts will decrease once eventually) or tolerate a close-fail HTable in their program(The HTable seems 'Using' by user from the view of HTablePool in this situation). On the other hand, removing the HTable from HTablePool.tables many times may not bring negative affect.
I see your point. Both options are fine for me as long as we understand what's going on.

Thanks for your comment, I add a new patch which including:
commont#1 fixed
comment#2 fixed
comment#3 add more specific comment at the place we call 'decrementAndGet'
comment#4 fixed
comment#5 the path is made over 0.94 branch
I'm sorry that I don't construct a test suite environment, do we have common platform to run the test suite?
rename patch name to "*.txt"

I will run the 0.94 test suite locally with your patch and post the results here. You can keep .patch, or .txt. No issues.

Any chance to add some test scenarios to validate that number of tables is following as expected?

Many tests failed...

I'm not concerned by most of them, but the 2 TestHTablePool tests are more concerning me.

I will try to re-run them separatly.

Tests are failing with NP on line 284:


concurrentUsedTableCounts.get(table).decrementAndGet();

Have you tried your patch locally? Is it working for you?

Should it be replaced by 


concurrentUsedTableCounts.get(tableName).decrementAndGet();

?

I'am sorry that I don't run the unit tests locally. Yes, it should be 

concurrentUsedTableCounts.get(tableName).decrementAndGet();

.

You're developing against 0.94 branch, yes? You can run test locally according to the instructions in the book. At the very least, before submitting a patch, I run

$ mvn clean package test -PrunSmallTests

You can also run specific tests with

$ mvn clean package test -Dtest=MyFavoriteTest
Jianwei Cui can you attached an updated version? I was able to run the tests successfuly with the updated code, but can you please run them too to make sure?
Thanks for your comment. I make a new patch to fix the bug, however, it's a little slow to compile the project, I will run the test locally and given the test result.
I have run TestHTablePool.java, all uts in TestHTabelPool have passed locally with HBASE-8220-0.94.3-v4.txt. Could please help to make sure HBASE-8220-0.94.3-v4.txt is OK?
[~Jean-Marc Spaggiari] doest the newest patch test successfully on your side? thanks.
Let me retry. I will let you know. Also, any chance to add a test to check that returned value is as expected?

Thanks very much for your concern and review. Maybe we can merge the patch to 0.94.6? By the way, could you please recommend a committer who is interested in HTablePool so that we can invite him/her to have a look?

The patch is for 0.94. So I don't think HadoopQA can handle it.

Oh bother, that's right.

Jean-Marc Spaggiari HTablePool is still on trunk. Do you have a link to the discussion around removing it?

Lars Hofhansl what are your thoughts on bringing this into 0.94?
0.94 is OK, but 0.94.8 at this point.

Nick Dimiduk I'm refering to this discussion: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hbase-dev/201303.mbox/%3CCALte62yPR0vmQQm7O_48SKQiecX_=bE7=vJVpyL+3uZQge7KAA@mail.gmail.com%3E

But I can't confirm if it's going to be deprecated. Today in trunk it's not deprecated. So should we do a the same patch for the trunk until we clearify if it's deprecated or not?

Yes, let's get a patch for trunk here as well.

The general guideline is to do new development against trunk first and back-port on a case-by-case basis. In that regard, this work is a little backwards.

Thanks for your comments. Sorry for response late. I generate a patch of this issue under trunk. However, the corresponding unit test 'TestHTablePool.java' has not been included in trunk. I try to copy 'TestHTablePool.java' from 0.94 to trunk; however it depends on other classes which will break build. Could we merge this patch into trunk firstly? Then, after we merge this patch into 0.94, we can merge corresponding update of 'TestHTablePool.java' to 0.94.

Thanks for your review, can we merge this patch to trunk? If we want to use this in 0.94, will we provide another patch for 0.94?

Jianwei Cui committing to trunk is out of my hands.

Yes, to apply a change to 0.94, it will need backported via a new patch. It's customary to ask the release manager if they'll accept the backport. If discussion is required, that generally happens on a new JIRA (ping Lars Hofhansl).
Jianwei Cui can you rebase your patch on last trunk version? Then we will see if anyone can commit it?
Cancelling stale patch
